lines.text: Why do you insist on spoiling a perfectly good New Year's Eve?
I haven't! It's hardly midnight. You won't lack company--you didn't earlier this evening...
[she plucks a hair from his shirtfront]

[pointing to her head]
No. \I'm a brunette.
Besides...I didn't think you noticed it.
I tried not to--for some time.
I've often wondered why it was necessary in some cases.
I'm really serious. I really mean it this time, Gerry!
No; I'm afraid there's be, uh, too little marriage and too much "all that."
It might work if you married all of us, the chorus girl, the widow...
Oh, it's a secret, nobody knows but me, and The Associated Press
Let's start this New Year's right.
I am starting it right, with myself.
